senses.de: Saying bad things about someone or something because they are not perfect
senses.ex: His criticism of her work was fair, it could have been better.

Tips.title: Negative Nuance
Tips.description: Criticism often implies negative feedback, even if it's constructive.
Tips.example: Despite his good intentions, his criticism stung a little.

Tips.title: Constructive Purpose
Tips.description: Use 'constructive criticism' to indicate the aim is to improve someone's work or behavior.
Tips.example: She welcomed the constructive criticism on her essay.

Tips.title: Emotional Impact
Tips.description: Be aware that criticism can affect people emotionally.
Tips.example: He felt discouraged after criticism from his coach.

senses.de: Assessing and making judgments about something, often a piece of work or performance
senses.ex: His criticism of the painting was well-received by the artists.

Tips.title: Critical Analysis
Tips.description: In arts and academics, criticism involves careful analysis, not just negative points.
Tips.example: Her criticism revealed the deeper meaning of the novel.

Tips.title: Subjective Views
Tips.description: Artistic criticism reflects personal taste and is often subjective.
Tips.example: His criticism of the film stemmed from his dislike of the genre.

Tips.title: Formal Context
Tips.description: Criticism in academic contexts should be formal and well-structured.
Tips.example: Her art criticism was published in a renowned journal.

senses.de: The activity of giving detailed information about the good and bad qualities of a work, especially a book, a movie, or a piece of art
senses.ex: Excellent film criticism should encourage audiences to see movies in a new light.

Tips.title: In-depth Knowledge
Tips.description: Effective media criticism requires thorough understanding of the subject.
Tips.example: His criticism of the director's work was informed by years of study.

Tips.title: Objective Assessment
Tips.description: Criticism in media should be more objective, focusing on technical and creative aspects.
Tips.example: The criticism addressed the cinematography and scriptwriting.

Blame.wordDefinition:
Blame is when you assign responsibility for something negative that has happened or a mistake that has been made. It often involves accusing someone of causing the issue intentionally or neglecting their responsibilities.

Blame tends to focus on the person's faults or shortcomings rather than understanding the factors that led to the problem.

In summary, blaming focuses on the past and the person's character, while criticism focuses on the present and how to address the issues constructively.

Blame is mostly used when someone is at fault or negligent, while criticism can be used in a wide range of situations where improvement is needed.

Censure.wordDefinition:
Censure and criticism are both words used to express disapproval, but they differ in intensity and purpose. Criticism typically refers to a constructive evaluation of someone or something, aimed at improving it.

Censure is a formal expression of strong disapproval or condemnation.

It is typically used in more serious situations and has a punitive or disciplinary aspect to it. For example, a government body may censure a politician for engaging in unethical behavior or a school may censure a student for violating school rules.

Criticism is a feedback to improve someone or something while censure is an official statement of condemnation for an action or behavior.

Condemnation.wordDefinition:
Condemnation means to express severe disapproval and judgment towards someone or something. It implies a strong negative stance or belief towards the person or thing being condemned.

Criticism refers to the expression of disapproval or judgment towards something, but without the strong negative connotations of condemnation.

Condemnation is for expressing strong negative judgment towards something that is morally wrong, while criticism is for giving feedback and evaluation in a more objective manner.

Denunciation.wordDefinition:
Denunciation refers to the act of publicly condemning or disapproving of something, often in a harsh or severe manner.

Denunciation is more applicable in situations where someone wants to express strong disapproval or condemnation of something, such as a political action or a criminal act.

Criticism is about offering suggestions for improvement while denunciation is about expressing extreme disapproval.

Disapproval.wordDefinition:
Disapproval refers to a negative judgment or reaction to something. It is a feeling of dislike or opposition towards something and does not necessarily offer any constructive suggestions for improvement.

Criticism is often used in professional settings like reviewing someone's work or giving feedback on an idea. Disapproval is more commonly used in personal relationships or expressing a negative reaction to something like a policy or decision.

Reprimand.wordDefinition:
A reprimand is a formal or official expression of disapproval or scolding for someone's behavior or actions. It is given with the intention of correcting the person's behavior and often carries a consequence or punishment.

Reprimand is applicable in situations where someone has behaved inappropriately or violated rules or expectations, such as in a workplace, school, or other organizational settings.

Criticism is a way to help someone grow and improve, while a reprimand is a way to hold someone accountable for their actions.

Reproach.wordDefinition:
Reproach refers to a statement or an expression of disapproval or disappointment towards someone for something they have done wrong or failed to do.

It is applicable when someone is expressing their disappointment or disapproval, such as a parent reproaching their child for breaking curfew, or a boss reproaching an employee for not meeting a deadline.

Criticism is focused on feedback and evaluation aimed at improvement, while reproach is focused on expressing disapproval or disappointment for something that has been done wrong.

quotes.Text: I've been online doing all kinds of research and that seems to be the constant criticism, that Aibileen's accent was just too thick. And for me, I don't want anything to distract from the character.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Viola Davis

quotes.Text: It doesn't really bother us, the team that is in fashion or that is being talked about the most. Whatever praise or criticism we receive doesn't really matter.
quotes.Title: Spanish Athlete
quotes.Name: Sergio Ramos

quotes.Text: Few people have the wisdom to prefer the criticism that would do them good, to the praise that deceives them.
quotes.Title: French Writer
quotes.Name: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.Text: The trouble with most of us is that we would rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.Text: You can't let praise or criticism get to you. It's a weakness to get caught up in either one.
quotes.Title: American Coach
quotes.Name: John Wooden

quotes.Text: Honest criticism means nothing: what one wants is unrestrained passion, fire for fire.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Henry Miller

quotes.Text: I love criticism just so long as it's unqualified praise.
quotes.Title: English Playwright
quotes.Name: Noel Coward

quotes.Text: He only profits from praise who values criticism.
quotes.Title: German Poet
quotes.Name: Heinrich Heine

quotes.Text: Sympathy is the first condition of criticism.
quotes.Title: Swiss Philosopher
quotes.Name: Henri Frederic Amiel

quotes.Text: I don't take praise or criticism seriously.
quotes.Title: Indian Athlete
quotes.Name: Jasprit Bumrah
